subject: RE: [junit] Simple JUnit with Annotations not working
msgSnippet: I had the same problem. Since Ant 1.6.5 was released before JUnit4 it doesn t know about it. I tried the same thing you did. I ended up upgrading to ant 1.7.0
messageBody:
I had the same problem. Since Ant 1.6.5 was released before JUnit4 it doesn't know about it. I tried the same thing you did. I ended up upgrading to ant 1.7.0 which works with JUnit4.

One thing I didn't try is renaming junit-4.6-RC1.jar to junit.jar (or whatever it is called in Ant 1.6.5 lib dir. But my guess it is still won't work.

Scott

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of David Saff
Sent: Tuesday, June 02, 2009 1:12 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Simple JUnit with Annotations not working





Surikoya,

Sounds frustrating. How are you running the test?

David Saff

On Tue, Jun 2, 2009 at 3:50 PM, surikoya <surikoya@...<mailto:surikoya%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
> I am trying the new annotations feature of JUnit4.
>
> Here is the program I am working with. I am using ant 1.6.5 and copied junit-4.6-RC1.jar to my <ant_home>/lib directory and put it in the classpath too. When I run the test I get a message which says "No Tests found in AnnotationsTest". Did I miss something basic?
>
> import org.junit.Test;
> import static org.junit.Assert.* ;
>
>
> public class AnnotationsTest {
>
> @Test
> public void addition() {
> assertEquals(12, 7+5);
> }
>
> @Test
> public void subtraction() {
> assertEquals(9, 12-3);
> }
> }
>
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
